author: Nancy Gonzales

review: I'm a huge Amazon.com fan. HUGE. The Fire TV Stick, however, is a disappointment. I do like the layout and ease of use, but I'm not happy with the overall function. The main apps I use are Amazon Instant Video and Netflix and occasionally You Tube and some of the games. The Amazon app works just fine, but the Netflix app has major issues. It constantly buffers, gives playback errors, and just doesn't stream smoothly. When I first got it, it didn't support HBO Go, but it does now. But, it does not support StarzPlay, which for me is a big deal, being a huge Outlander fan (plus the fact Starz has great movies). I've looked online and it appears that I am not the only one that has these issues with this device, so it irritates me that Amazon hasn't addressed it and created a fix for it. I think I'm going to put the Amazon stick away and bring my Roku back downstairs. I have zero streaming problems with that device (except that it also doesn't have StarzPlay).Updated: StarzPlay and EncorePlay are now available on this! Hooray! The streaming quality still sucks, though. I even moved it to my bedroom, which is much closer to our wireless router, and it still buffers and hiccups and annoys the crap out of me. The Roku is still the better streaming device, in my opinion, and my Roku is a previously-owned, older model. It's earned its way back into my living room and will stay there until it dies.
